intro: Greggia camporum var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf greggia, is a perennial plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and ability to store water in its leaves. The plant features small, fleshy, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. Its leaves are narrow and linear, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
